required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Work of Breathing in Premature Infants at Discharge
clinical_study.official_title: Work of Breathing and Oxygen Saturation Stability in Premature Infants With History of Respiratory Insufficiency Prior to Discharge

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare how premature infants who required oxygen for at least 28 days during their time in the NICU (Neonatal Intensive Care Unit) breathe at discharge compared to premature infants who did not require oxygen for at least 28 days during their time in the NICU.

detailed_description.textblock: Work of breathing tests will be performed on premature infants who required oxygen for at least 28 days during their time in NICU. These same work of breathing tests will be performed in another group of premature infants who did not require oxygen for at least 28 days during their time in the NICU. The two groups will be compared.

primary_outcome.description: Respiratory Inductance Plethysmography (RIP) measurements will be taken and Phase Angle will be measured.

secondary_outcome.description: Oxygen saturation will be measured using a high resolution pulse oximeter.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Infants WITH diagnosis of bronchopulmonary dysplasia (BPD)
arm_group.description: Preterm infants who were on oxygen at 28 days of life.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Infants WITHOUT diagnosis of bronchopulmonary dysplasia (BPD
arm_group.description: Preterm infants who were not on oxygen at 28 days of life.

intervention.description: All infants whose families consent will be enrolled and will all receive the same treatment which included measurements of work of breathing.
intervention.arm_group_label: Infants WITH diagnosis of bronchopulmonary dysplasia (BPD)
Infants WITHOUT diagnosis of bronchopulmonary dysplasia (BPD

study_pop.textblock: Preterm infants born greater than 26 weeks gestation, weighing less than 1500 grams at birth. Work of breathing indices will be compared between the group of babies who were diagnosed with BPD and the group that was not diagnosed with BPD.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Infants born at greater than 26 weeks gestation, weighing less than 1500 grams at birth.
- Infants with diagnosis of BPD and without diagnosis of BPD
Exclusion Criteria:
- Infants with skeletal, neuromuscular, or abdominal surgical disorders that affect the accuracy of work of breathing measurements will be excluded.
